prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a square base and a rectangular top The first part is a rectangular prism. It has a square base and a rectangular top that is offset from the base by a distance equal to the height of the prism. The prism is centered on the white background. Steps to create the coordinate system 1. Create a new coordinate system. 2. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) to define the orientation of the coordinate system. 3. Set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0039, 0.0) to define the position of the coordinate system. Steps to create the sketch The sketch is created on the XY plane of the coordinate system. It consists of two loops: loop 1 (outer rectangle) and loop 2 (inner rectangle). Loop 1: outer rectangle 1. Create a new line between points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.0). 2. Create a new line between points (0.75, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.4221). 3. Create a new line between points (0.75, 0.4221) and (0.0, 0.4221). 4. Close the loop by connecting the end of the last line to the start of the first line. Loop 2: inner rectangle 1. Create a new line between points (0.0622, 0.1515) and (0.1505, 0.1515). 2. Create a new line between points (0.1505, 0.1515) and (0.1505, 0.1993). 3. Create a new line between points (0.1505, 0.1993) and (0.0622, 0.1993). 4. Close the loop by connecting the end of the last line to the start of the first line. Steps to create the extrusion 1. Define the extrusion depth towards the normal as 0.0039. 2. Define the extrusion depth opposite the normal as 0.0. 3. Define the sketch scale as 0.75. 4. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation. Description The part is a rectangular prism. The square base measures 0.75 units by 0.75 units. The rectangular top has a length of 0.75 units (matched to the base's width) and a width of 0.0039 units (determined by the height of the prism and the offset). The height of the prism is 0.75 units.</description>
